title: Advanced SEO - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Bill Slawski May 21, 2015 The Long Click and the Quality of Search Success Technical SEO | Advanced SEO A recent patent filing from Google offers hints about the long click, and in this post Bill Slawski helps decode the legalese. Read this post By: Eric Enge May 13, 2015 Inverse Document Frequency and the Importance of Uniqueness On-page SEO | Advanced SEO | Keyword Research Can learning about Inverse Document Frequency teach us to create better content? It can, and this article explains how. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers May 7, 2015 I Can't Drive 155: Meta Descriptions in 2015 On-page SEO | Advanced SEO For years, we've suggested a 155-character limit to meta descriptions. As long snippets appear more and more often, is it time to revise that rule? Read this post By: Tom Anthony April 28, 2015 Search Trends: Are Compound Queries the Start of the Shift to Data-Driven Search? Advanced SEO | Search Engines We increasingly use apps, wearables, smart assistants, smart watches and smart TVs for searches, and none of these are returning the 10 blue links of days gone by. These technologies and trends are intersecting and converging, giving rise to a new paradigm of search: Data-Driven Search. Read this post By: Adam Whittles April 23, 2015 How to Ace the Google Mobile-Friendly Test & Score 100% Advanced SEO | SEO Tools | Mobile SEO Use the results of our study to help improve your site's mobile friendliness score. Read this post C By: Craig Bradford April 20, 2015 Google Told Me I'm Pregnant: From Strings to Diagnosis Advanced SEO What's Google's next step? If Craig Bradford is right, the search engine giant could become your partner in healthcare. Learn more about how their data could provide early diagnoses. Read this post By: Eric Enge April 15, 2015 Using Term Frequency Analysis to Measure Your Content Quality Content Marketing | Advanced SEO | Competitive Research A spreadsheet and term frequency analysis can yield surprising insights into what Google might see when it looks at your content Read this post By: Moosa Hemani April 14, 2015 How to Write Emails That Get Opened Every Time Link Building | Advanced SEO Looking to increase your email open rates? Implementing these few simple tips could result in significant gains. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers April 9, 2015 The Incredible Shrinking SERP - 2015 Edition Advanced SEO | Search Engines First, there were 10 results, then sometimes 7, and now as few as 4. In the past year, Google has changed the page-1 landscape entirely, and we barely noticed. Read this post By: Nathan Byloff April 8, 2015 Use the Google PageSpeed Module to Dramatically Increase the Speed of Your Website Technical SEO | Advanced SEO A fast website is no longer a luxury; it an expectation from site visitors and search engines. Google's PageSpeed Module can give you a leg up in creating a better user experience. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin March 30, 2015 Spam Score: Moz's New Metric to Measure Penalization Risk Advanced SEO | Moz Tools Moz's Spam Score metric helps quantify the relative risk of penalization/banning by search engines using a series of correlated flags. This post helps explain where you can find Spam Score, how to use it, and the R&D behind its development. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers March 23, 2015 Moving 5 Domains to 1: An SEO Case Study Advanced SEO Should you change domain names for SEO? It's a tough question, usually asked way too casually. I merged 5 domains into 1, and this is what happened. Read this post By: Jared Gardner March 18, 2015 How to Stop Spam Bots From Ruining Your Analytics Referral Data Technical SEO | SEO Analytics | Advanced SEO Don't give spam bots a free ride on your website. Create an inhospitable environment for the invasive pests in a few simple steps. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers March 11, 2015 How We Fixed the Internet (Ok, an Answer Box) On-page SEO | Advanced SEO Last year, Google introduced answers boxes scraped from the index. I didn't like one of mine, so I tried to change it. Months later, something finally happened. Read this post
